title: ODU 'student' posts White Power rap video | Daily Mail Online
text: comments A young girl wearing a KKK hood and Donald Trump mask launched a racist rant in a viral video condemning 'N**** History Month'. The video titled 'White Gal - White Power' shows a young woman in an Old Dominion University sweatshirt, who claims to be a student, reciting a hateful rap using expletives and racial slurs in a rant against black people. She later wears a mask that appears to be of Donald Trump and a KKK hood. A civil rights group and officials at Old Dominion University have condemned the video. YouTube posted on its website that the clip had been removed for violating the site's policy on hate speech. Scroll down for video The video titled 'White Gal - White Power' shows a young woman in an ODU sweatshirt reciting a hateful rap using expletives and racial slurs in a rant against black people. She later wears a mask that appears to be of Donald Trump, seen right, and left, a KKK hood The Norfolk, Virginia University's chapter of the NAACP hosted an event on Tuesday to address the video, after it prompted outrage when it was shared Monday by a user on Twitter and viewed more than 3,500 times. The video was originally posted on February 4 by a user named 'Wobble Head,' who claims in the tagged section to be a 'ODU student aspired rapper', according to the Virginia-Pilot . The University said it did not know if the woman in the video is a student. Some on social media have attempted to identify her by a noticeable tattoo that can be seen. The University said they do not know if the woman in the video is a confirmed student. Some on social media have attempted to identify her by a noticeable tattoo that can be seen in the video ODU President John Broderick said in a statement that the 'vile video' represents an act of hate and intolerance - in violation of the University's 'climate of inclusion'. Matt Thomas, spokesman for the ODU NAACP, told The Virginia-Pilot that the video was even more offensive because it was posted during Black History month. At one point, the 'rapper' put out a cigarette on a piece of paper that said 'Black Lives Matter' In the opening of the two-and-a-half minute video, the user broadcasted the phrase in all capital letters, 'N HISTORY MONTH'. Thomas said: 'To be honest, I didn't finish the video the first time I watched it. I was trying to process what I heard. 'It's scary to know that in 2017, I could be sitting next to someone in class who wants to see me back on a plantation or hung.' At one point, the 'rapper' put out a cigarette on a piece of paper that said 'Black Lives Matter'. The rhetoric of the video encouraged the killing of black people, and support of President Donald Trump. The woman rapping in the video wore a t-shirt with Donald Trump's face emblazoned with the phrase 'My President is White'. RELATED ARTICLES
